metadata.Title: CVE-2023-35001 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
Linux Kernel nftables Out-Of-Bounds Read/Write Vulnerability; nft_byteorder poorly handled vm register contents when CAP_NET_ADMIN is in any user or network namespace Tanguy Dubroca discovered that the netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly handle certain pointer data type, leading to an out-of- bounds write vulnerability. A privileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-35001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-170-generic - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-lowlatency - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-170-generic - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-170-lowlatency - 3.13.0-194.245
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1121-aws - 4.4.0-1121.127
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1

notes.Note: eslerm> reporter at Pwn2Own 2023 as ZDI-CAN-20721 CWE-787 sbeattie> requires CAP_NET_ADMIN in any network namespace

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-194.245').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1121.127').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1').
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-194.245').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1').
